page.content: Thus the stagnant layer is permanently avoided and the dirtiest water remains in the reservoir.It is via these two outlets that water is ducted into the water treatment plant situated approximately a quarter of a mile further down the valley. Once inside the treatment works,the water is first disinfected,by the injection of the liquid gas chlorine under pressure.A liquid form of alum is next introduced.This acts as a coagulent,which brings all the dirt and algae together and facilitates their removal.The water then passes on to the huge filter beds of which there are sixteen.Each bed contains six tons of sand and five thousand gallons pass through each bed every hour.Here the water is purified.So much dirt is removed that every filter has to be backwashed once every day.
